title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says South-West monsoon conditions are gradually getting established over the island.

title: Former US President Biden diagnosed with ‘aggressive’ prostate cancer
byline: Former U.S. President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with an “aggressive form” of prostate cancer that has spread to his bones, his office said in a statement on Sunday.

title: Thai national arrested with ‘Kush’ worth Rs. 79 mn at BIA
byline: A foreign national has been arrested at the arrival terminal of Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake early this morning (19) by officers of the Customs Narcotics Control Unit for smuggling Kush cannabis, estimated to be worth around Rs. 79 million.

title: BASL expresses concern over social media posts targeting judicial officers
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has expressed deep concern about several online media posts, including those on social media that are targeting judicial officers.

title: Deshabandu to appear before inquiry committee today
byline: The inquiry committee, appointed to investigate and report on allegations of misconduct and serious abuse of office against Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, is scheduled to commence its investigation today (May 19).

title: Pro-EU centrist wins Romania’s presidential race over hard-right nationalist
byline: The liberal, pro-EU mayor of Bucharest, Nicusor Dan, has fought off a strong challenge from a Romanian right-wing nationalist to win the presidency after months of political turbulence.

title: War Heroes’ Day Ceremony to take place in Battaramulla under President’s patronage
byline: All arrangements have been finalized for the National War Heroes’ Day celebrations, which will commemorate the 16th anniversary of the victory that ended the brutal terrorism which afflicted the country for over three decades.

title: Pause in India-Pakistan hostilities to continue
byline: The cessation of hostilities agreed upon by India and Pakistan on May 12 will continue, according to a statement by the Indian Army.

title: Luxury liner ‘AIDAstella’ makes maiden call at Hambantota Port
byline: The Hambantota International Port (HIP) has marked a significant milestone in its cruise operations, welcoming the Sphinx class ‘AIDAstella’, the first vessel from AIDA Cruises to call at the port.

title: MP Chamara Sampath granted bail
byline: The New Democratic Front (NDF) Badulla District Member of Parliament Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been granted bail.

title: Lufthansa flight flew without a pilot for 10 minutes after co-pilot fainted, report finds
byline: A Lufthansa flight with 205 people on board went without a pilot for 10 minutes last year after the co-pilot fainted while he was alone in the cockpit, according to a new report from Spain’s accident investigation authority.

title: Sri Lanka’s manufacturing sector declines in April 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for manufacturing declined in April 2025 due to contraction in several key sub-indices, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) said.

title: Ex-Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage appears in court
byline: Former Minister of Agriculture Mahindananda Aluthgamage, who is the subject of an arrest warrant in connection with the importation of a shipment of substandard organic fertilizer from a Chinese company during the previous administration, has appeared before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today (19).

title: Court orders police to submit progress report in Kotahena schoolgirl suicide case
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today directed Police to submit a report on the progress of the investigation into the schoolteacher suspected of abusing a schoolgirl who subsequently committed suicide in Kotahena.

title: SJB-UNP agree to establish power in LG bodies where opposition has majority
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) and the United National Party (UNP) have come to a preliminary agreement in relation to the establishment of power within local government bodies that have a majority for the opposition.

title: Terror attack averted in Hyderabad, 2 ISIS-linked suspects arrested
byline: A local court in Andhra Pradesh’s Vizianagaram town on Sunday evening remanded two suspected terrorists, allegedly linked to a Saudi Arabia-based outfit, to 14 days of judicial custody, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued for severe lightning in several provinces.

title: Former MP Milan Jayatilleke arrested
byline: Former Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Milan Jayatilleke has been arrested by the Bribery Commission.

title: President vows to prevent repetition of past tragedies during visit to war heroes
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake paid a visit this morning (19) to the Mihindu Seth Medura convalescent home in Attidiya, where he inquired into the health and wellbeing of the resident war heroes currently receiving long-term care at the facility.

title: Suspected gunman in Mount Lavinia shooting arrested
byline: The Mount Lavinia Division Criminal Investigation Unit has arrested the suspected shooter involved in the murder of a youth in a shooting incident that occurred earlier this month at a junction near Sylvester Road in Mount Lavinia.

title: Ex-Minister Mahindananda remanded
byline: Former Minister of Agriculture Mahindananda Aluthgamage has been remanded until May 26 after appearing before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today (19).

title: Gunmen open fire at shop in Dehiwala
byline: Sri Lanka Police reported that two men who arrived on a motorcycle have opened fire at a shop in Nedimala, Dehiwala.

title: Parliament to convene from May 20 to 23
byline: The Secretary General of Parliament, Kushani Rohanadeera, announced that Parliament is scheduled to convene from Tuesday, May 20 to Friday, May 23.

title: Former MP Milan Jayatilleke granted bail
byline: Former Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Milan Jayatilleke has been granted bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court after being arrested earlier today (19).

title: Nvidia plans to sell tech to speed AI chip communication
byline: Nvidia said on Monday it plans to sell a technology to others that will tie chips together in order to speed up the chip-to-chip communication needed to build and deploy artificial intelligence tools.

title: Complaint filed with Bribery Comm. over Presidential Secretariat vehicle auction
byline: A complaint has been lodged with the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) regarding the auction of vehicles belonging to the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Promotions granted to tri-forces personnel to mark National War Heroes’ Day
byline: As part of the 16th National War Heroes’ Day celebrations, promotions have been granted to officers and other ranks across the tri-forces.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon appears before inquiry committee
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon appeared before the Parliamentary Inquiry Committee today (May 19), which is tasked with investigating allegations of misconduct and serious abuse of office against him.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several areas in six districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued for multiple areas in six districts as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: China to cut gasoline, diesel retail prices
byline: China will reduce the retail prices of gasoline and diesel on Tuesday to reflect recent changes in international oil prices, the country’s top economic planner said.
